Pouch.description: The simple is mainly made from simple cloth, sturdy leather, or fine silk and features a drawstring that threads through reinforced holes in a looping pattern. It is mainly intended to carry coins, though it can also hold materials or small objects depending on the need.

Prehnite.name: Prehnite
Prehnite.description: Prehnite is often found in the lining of gas cavities in hardened lava formations. However, the material rarely possesses the required thickness or attractive coloration to be considered for gemstone cutting.

Pressure Gauge.name: Pressure Gauge
Pressure Gauge.description: An pressure gauge is a measuring instrument used to monitor the force within contained systems, such as steam conduits or alchemical apparatus. Some variants are focused on arcane mechanisms, using enchanted fluids or elemental spirits to detect fluctuations in force that would be invisible to the naked eye.

Pressurized Container.name: Pressurized Container
Pressurized Container.description: Created specifically to contain the most volatile materials and keep them under pressure, such as specific gases, air, breaths of mythical beasts, or arcane compounds. Usually, if one of these fissures occurs, even though made from sturdy materials, disaster strikes.

Pumpkin.name: Pumpkin
Pumpkin.description: It is assumed to be one of the most festive vegetables out there. Pumpkins are used in most festival events for Pumpkin carving, decorations or pumpkin chunking in which teams attempt to throw pumpkins as far as possible with the help of catapults, trebuchets or ballistas are often common in these games. Pumpkins sometimes are also associated with local legends where the pumpkin is a stand-in for a creature's head. Taverns keep the seeds and roast them to provide to their guests as a snack, and with the help of the pulp, one of the most delicious forms of pie is created, however, it can be an acquired taste.

Pumpkin Stew.name: Pumpkin Stew
Pumpkin Stew.description: The recipe for Pumpkin Stew varies depending on the region or, in some rare cases, among taverns. Multiple recipes exist containing either a variety of meats or solely vegetables, offering a wide range of culinary experiences.

Pure Day.name: Pure Day
Pure Day.description: Pure Day is usually a poor excuse for the regular commoner to keep drinking during a heatwave. The brew itself is not strong, and it resembles, in taste, a cooling lemonade, but the base is ale. One persistent rumor claims that when combined with Morning Breeze and Evernight, it grants immortality. But considering the variation of the recipe, this sounds outright like a fabricated lie.

Pure-Metal Brass Ingot.name: Pure-Metal Brass Ingot
Pure-Metal Brass Ingot.description: Pure-Metal Brass Ingots are manufactured from the finest curated copper and zinc. They have become increasingly popular for crafting religious objects such as candlesticks, cathedral bells, and reliquaries, often fetching a high price. Though slightly softer than bronze, its corrosion resistance makes it ideal for naval and coastal and naval military gear.

Pure-Metal Bronze Ingot.name: Pure-Metal Bronze Ingot
Pure-Metal Bronze Ingot.description: Pure-Metal Bronze Ingots are made from an alloy of the most refined chunks of copper and tin, in equal amounts. Skilled blacksmiths at prestigious smelters refine the metals through precise smelting techniques, ensuring that every ingot maintains a uniform composition. Without impurities or flaws, these blacksmiths can forge higher than normal quality tools, weapons, armor, and building materials such as decorative tiles for flooring or detailed sculptures.

Purple Berries.name: Purple Berries
Purple Berries.description: Purple berries are palpably sweet, Gatherers and Herbalists recommend eating them in small quantities, as health complications may occur. Brewmasters use them to give their ales more interesting colors, as well as make their beverages sweeter.

Purple Brittlegill.name: Purple Brittlegill
Purple Brittlegill.description: The Purple Brittlegill is large, with a dark vinaceous or purple cap, and white or cream-colored gills, a mushroom that is edible. Herbalists recommend that due to some brittlegills being toxic, it's important to only eat mushrooms that you can recognize. If unsure, better avoid it.

Purple Emperor.name: Purple Emperor
Purple Emperor.description: Purple Emperor is an magnificent butterfly which flies high in the treetops of very dense forests. Alchemists, usually keep a few in a butterfly house for breeding, as they are an rare reagent in some of the most rare potions.

Purple Pink Diamond.name: Purple Pink Diamond
Purple Pink Diamond.description: Sometimes also referred to as fancy diamonds, they are extremely rare. It is also speculated that the wearers of specific diamonds can be protected from some spells or enchantments.

Purple Vampire Crab.name: Purple Vampire Crab
Purple Vampire Crab.description: A an amazing thing I have heard, from an old delta crabber, is that the intensity of the purple on their shells predicts the severity of the coming winter. The deeper the purple, the harder the frosts. He also swore that if you keep one in a tank, it will only thrive if you add a pinch of silt from its home delta each month. He called it "homesickness," and I think he might be right.

Puzzle Box.name: Puzzle Box
Puzzle Box.description: This small toy comes with a disclaimer stating that it contains small parts. While it is mechanized, the Puzzle Box is mostly aimed at young children to help them with cognitive development. It contains many small cogs and gears. However, when it is finally opened, parents always leave a treat for the children.

Pyrope.name: Pyrope
Pyrope.description: Pyrope, a type of garnet known for its exquisite beauty, also holds military significance. It is believed that adorning weaponry with this garnet allows it to penetrate the thickest hides or demolish the strongest doors, aided by arcane forces.

Quark Balls.name: Quark Balls
Quark Balls.description: Quark balls are a type of pastry made from a mixture of cheese, eggs, flour, sugar, lemon zest, and vanilla extract and after cooking, sprinkled with cinnamon and sugar. These baked goods are mostly served at major events, like festivals, season markets, as well as, carnivals.

Quartz.name: Quartz
Quartz.description: The deep sky blue color of this gem, somewhat rare, doesn't have many uses and it's used for ornamentation. When spells require gems that are not attached to a value, Quartz is the go-to gemstone for casters, as it has low price.

Quartzite.name: Quartzite
Quartzite.description: Quartzite is a decorative stone and may be used to cover walls, as roofing tiles, flooring, and stairsteps, due to its strength, it is also used to construct roads, bridges, and dams. When cut and polished, the rock is quite beautiful, as well as durable.

Quince.name: Quince
Quince.description: A common fruit in most home gardens, it is often preserved over the coldest of winters with little care. Quince can also be used for hay fever, stomach pains, and many other conditions, however, it is mainly known for its use in jellies and jams.

Rabbit.name: Rabbit
Rabbit.description: Commonly referred to as the meat rabbit, these rabbits are primarily harvested for their meat. However, in regions where hunting was not readily available, both wild rabbits and domestic rabbits were also harvested for pelts.

Radish.name: Radish
Radish.description: The root of the radish is usually eaten raw, although it is more often than not steamed. They are mostly used in salads but they also appear in some regional dishes. The seeds of radishes can be pressed to extract radish seed oil.

Rake.name: Rake
Rake.description: Rakes come in various types, but the two most common are garden rakes and soil rakes. Garden rakes are effectively designed to pick up leaves and other garden debris without causing damage to the lawn and the soil beneath. On the other hand, soil rakes are intended for leveling and grading the soil before plants and seeds are planted.

Ramen.name: Ramen
Ramen.description: Ramen is a flavorful soup made with noodles and pork, typically seasoned with soy sauce and miso. It is often served with a variety of toppings, including sliced bacon, scallions, and sometimes fish, dried seaweed, or eggs.

Ramie.name: Ramie
Ramie.description: Ramie, also called grass linen, is a fiber derived from a type of nettle. Known for its strength and luster, it is an ideal material for creating fabrics suited to warm climates. Beyond textiles, it is also used in making fishing nets, filter cloths, and occasionally, paper.

Raspberry.name: Raspberry
Raspberry.description: Raspberries are grown for the fresh fruit market, and most of them end up made either in a variety of juices or as a fruit puree. They are also sought after by bakers as the raspberry pie is one of the most favorite sweets of the young folk.

Ravenar.name: Ravenar
Ravenar.description: The luster of this gem closely resembles the eyes of a raven, and those who are well-versed with magic casting speculate that it has the ability to hold the souls of the living. It is strongly believed that it possess a dark energy, to help with with the arts of the undead, and its smooth, glossy surface seems to pulse similarity to a slow heartbeat

Records.name: Records
Records.description: Public records are typically created by the local archivist to store information specific to the town. This information is kept to track changes over extended periods of time. The records usually include details such as buildings constructed, resources harvested and traded, taxes collected, elections held, and many other town-specific matters. The archivist ensures that the public records are well-organized, accessible, and preserved for future generations.

Red Cabbage.name: Red Cabbage
Red Cabbage.description: The red cabbage is often used raw for salads and coleslaw, a perfect side dish for roast goose or turkey. The red cabbage is a farmer's favorite as it lasts winters, as is, not needing to be turned into sauerkraut in order to be preserved.

Red Cherry Sticks.name: Red Cherry Sticks
Red Cherry Sticks.description: Cherry sticks are a popular candy made from simple ingredients like sugar, starch, wheat flour, gelatin, and cherries. The combination of the chewy outer layer with the smooth, sweet middle creates a delightful treat for any young commoner.

Red Dye.name: Red Dye
Red Dye.description: The red dye is relatively rare and is primarily found in specific insects that are mostly located on cacti. Depending on the climate and territory, they may not be easily accessible. After harvesting, the insects are crushed into a fine powder, dried, and filtered to remove any residue. The remaining material can be used as a dye for fabrics or paints.

Red Obsidian.name: Red Obsidian
Red Obsidian.description: Red Obsidian is also referred to as Mahogany Obsidian, due to the color of the gem resembling the wood. This is formed when the arcane arts cool pools of lava quickly. Some legerdemains try to sell these as a premium under the premise that it has untapped magical potential, however, their usual price is close to the one of the regular obsidian.

Red Onion.name: Red Onion
Red Onion.description: Also referred to as purple onion, it is usually served fresh, as a salad or part of mixed salads, and especially as a compulsory garnish for some traditional bean-and-smoked ham soups.

Red Paper Wasp.name: Red Paper Wasp
Red Paper Wasp.description: Red Paper is a non-hostile type of wasp that becomes aggressive only when its nest is threatened. Their venom can be collected by herbalists to produce medicine, safely harvested due to the insect’s docile behavior.

Red Revenant's Refresher.name: Red Revenant's Refresher
Red Revenant's Refresher.description: The base recipe for this unique concoction is almost identical to the traditional Kompot recipe, with one major ingredient change that sets it apart. Instead of water, the sanguine fluid of creatures is used as a replacement. This is to provide some variation in taste for the night beings. The sanguine fluid is harvested from various creatures, ranging from small rodents to large beasts, depending on the desired flavor. However, due to the taboo nature of its primary ingredient, it is often created and consumed in secrecy and with caution.

Red Topaz.name: Red Topaz
Red Topaz.description: Also referred to as Jacinth, Flamegem, or sometimes Corundum it is one of the most common gems used in magical crafting. Due to its very specific use, its price can range widely. Outside of magical use it is one of the most durable minerals after the Diamond. Gaffers use it as a cheaper alternative to create glass cutters.

Redwood Log.name: Redwood Log
Redwood Log.description: A universal wood log, it can be used in anything really but usually found in carpentry and general construction, ranging from indoor and outdoor furniture, shingles, fence posts, paneling, and even arrow shafts.

Redwood Plank.name: Redwood Plank
Redwood Plank.description: Usually used for creating boxes, tables, stools, bats, and bridges, and due to it, it has quite a high demand for anyone with a background in any form of construction.

Reed Plant.name: Reed Plant
Reed Plant.description: The common water reed occurs along the margins of lakes, fens, marshes, and streams, from the most Nordic regions to the warmest places. Dried reed stems have been used for aeons as thatching and construction material, in basketry, for arrows and pens, and in musical instruments.

Regal Mark.name: Regal Mark
Regal Mark.description: When a king ascends to the throne, whether by succession, conquest, or assassination, a unique medallion coin is forged for them. This gold medallion features a dark-red diamond at its center, serving as a commemoration of the event and a means of quick identification if the king ever needs to blend in with their subjects. As each medallion is unique and only a limited number exist in circulation, some have the buying power to purchase anything on an entire continent.

Retama.name: Retama
Retama.description: Retama is usually a tree that is not harvested for its wood, however, the leaves and the seed pods make excellent food for most grazing animals. Herbalists make from the leaves and young branches of the Retama tree teas to treat pain, fevers, or infections.

Rhenium.name: Rhenium
Rhenium.description: Rhenium, sometimes referred to as the "Alchemist's Metal," is primarily used in the making of alloys with tungsten. To experienced alchemists, Rhenium symbolizes the perfection of all matter physical, mental, and spiritual. In many potions, a single drop of liquid Rhenium is added to strengthen their potency.

Rhodizite.name: Rhodizite
Rhodizite.description: This precious stone, with its translucent appearance ranging from pale yellow to green, was commonly found in small, fragmented crystals. Due to its limited cleavage, it was primarily utilized for carving rather than faceting. Gem cutters focused their efforts on crystals that could be fashioned into faceted gems.

Rhodochrosite.name: Rhodochrosite
Rhodochrosite.description: Or commonly named Rosenstone is highly demanded by nobility due to its pink color. It's well known that they usually go out of their way to acquire this type of gem. Used for ornamentation in earrings, rings, necklaces, or bracelets. Several Rosenstone pieces, if correctly crushed and mixed with additional herbs, are assumed to neutralize most poisons and diseases.

Rhodonite.name: Rhodonite
Rhodonite.description: Rhodonite is an attractive gemstone primarily valued for its ornamental use, featuring vivid pink coloring. It is frequently incorporated into jewelry, typically in the form of beads or cabochons.

Rhubarb.name: Rhubarb
Rhubarb.description: One of the rarest spring fruits, usually used in pies and tarts, or sometimes used to create sugars. Herbalists often prescribe it as a remedy for issues related to indigestion, or to calm the nerves when strong emotions are involved. In magic, it is used, on rare occasions, as a spell component.

Rhubarb Pie.name: Rhubarb Pie
Rhubarb Pie.description: Rhubarb Pie delights with its sweet and tangy taste, accentuated by a fruity filling that holds together nicely. Since rhubarb is a seasonal vegetable, this pie is only available for a limited time after the cold seasons.

Rock Salt.name: Rock Salt
Rock Salt.description: Salt is used extensively in cooking as a key ingredient, and to cure a wide variety of foods such as pork and fish. Gatherers create a mixture of salt and water to use as a weed killer in fields of valuable crops.

Rockfish.name: Rockfish
Rockfish.description: Rockfish, also known as Rock Cod or Rock Snapper, inhabit rocky reefs and seafloors, ranging from shallow nearshore waters to the deep ocean. Beneath the ocean’s surface, Rockfish hover near rocky outcrops, their spiny dorsal fins blending well into the rugged terrain. Some Rockfish dwell in the water column, while others remain motionless beneath the kelp canopy in the giant kelp forests.

Rosaline.name: Rosaline
Rosaline.description: Rosaline, also referred to as pink zoisite, is a gemstone known for its ability to exhibit three distinct colors, purple, red, and either blue or green, depending on the viewing angle. When crushed, Rosaline is used to create hair or paint dye, producing a lovely pink-red hue.

Rose.name: Rose
Rose.description: Rose is a flower with many purposes for the regular folk. Symbolically, it serves as a timeless token of love, often shared on first dates or anniversaries. Practically, rose bushes are used as a gardening tool to enhance the visual appeal of parks and gardens. In some distinct regions, rose jam is coveted for its distinctive flavor.

Rose Gold.name: Rose Gold
Rose Gold.description: Rose gold, created by combining pure gold and copper, is popular in specialized jewelry. It is more malleable than pure gold, making it a preferred material for whitesmiths, and it is less expensive than gold or white gold.

Royal Signet.name: Royal Signet
Royal Signet.description: Royal Signet is a piece of jewelry, typically custom-made for the nobility. The most renowned jewelers are usually commissioned for this precise work, as the impression it leaves in wax must be as detailed and clear as possible. The band is generally crafted from gold, while the signet itself is forged from a combination of alloys that can be replaced or reworked into the ring with ease if needed.

Rubellite.name: Rubellite
Rubellite.description: Rubellite, a pink variant of tourmaline, stands out as the rarest gem in its family. Occasionally mistaken for ruby, it is a target for exploitation by unscrupulous merchants.

Ruby Spinel.name: Ruby Spinel
Ruby Spinel.description:
"They say, if you ingest these, although, I wouldn't recommend it one bit, you can remember spells. Now I wonder, how can someone forget?" 

Spinel is a rare mineral, and due to it, used to substitute even rarer ones like rubies. The blue variant is one of the most expensive gemstones on the market.

Ruined Pelt.name: Ruined Pelt
Ruined Pelt.description: The unskilled leatherworkers' handiworks. These are usually from either training pelts to train new hires or an actual mistake. They usually have limited uses, but in most scenarios, they end up as either leather strips, shoelaces, or rope, and are rarely added to an implement.

Runner Peanut.name: Runner Peanut
Runner Peanut.description: Peanuts are useful in the making of peanut oil, peanut butter, roasted peanuts, salted and sweet peanut bars, and peanut sauce but they can also be eaten raw or salted.

Rutabaga.name: Rutabaga
Rutabaga.description: Rutabaga is often seen as a food of last resort, linked to food shortages in wartime. Boiled stew made solely from rutabaga and water is a common dish during major conflicts. Rutabaga roots and tops serve as a valuable forage crop for winter livestock feed.

Rutile.name: Rutile
Rutile.description: Rutile, in its natural crystal state, serves two main distinct purposes, decorating pottery with intricate designs and adding ornamentation to already placed gemstones. Found in large deposits, it is sometimes used in crafting entire pottery pieces or as striking ornamental accents on furniture.

Rutile Powder.name: Rutile Powder
Rutile Powder.description: Rutile when ground into a fine powder, it turns into a beautiful pigment, bringing color to canvases and ceramics alike. In the world of medicine, its strength and resistance to corrosion make it a primary material, protecting implants and ensuring their longevity.

Rutiled Quartz.name: Rutiled Quartz
Rutiled Quartz.description: Rutilated quartz is a variety of quartz that contains needle-like strikes within the gem. These inclusions may be distributed randomly or in bundles, which sometimes are arranged star-like, and they can be sparse or dense enough to make the quartz body nearly opaque. While in general inclusions often reduce the value of any other crystal, rutilated quartz is valued for the quality of these inclusions.

Saddle Soft Cured Pelt.name: Saddle Soft Cured Pelt
Saddle Soft Cured Pelt.description: An specific form of pelt, cured and processed, but not cut, to simply be put on an equine for the saddle to feel better and not create any scratches or cuts on the skin of the animal. The pelt itself, after the process is complete, does not have many other uses, other than decorative as a table cover.

Safe Balm.name: Safe Balm
Safe Balm.description: A small balm created by alchemists to alleviate pain. It is however speculated that, if it is rubbed on the skin, it can also cure fevers, as well, as colds. This is a belief held by most commonfolk and usually used to treat their children.

Sailing Mast.name: Sailing Mast
Sailing Mast.description: The sailing mast is a pole that rises vertically from a ship and supports the sails. Larger sailboats often have more than one mast. The mast plays a crucial role in supporting the sails, allowing the wind to propel the ship.

Salmon Steak.name: Salmon Steak
Salmon Steak.description: Salmon, primarily sourced from specific cold regions, is considered a rare and pricey meal due to its scarcity. Taverns, often with divine or magical assistance to keep it fresh, obtain salmon and typically sell it at a substantial premium pricing.

Salty Cocoa Nut Bars.name: Salty Cocoa Nut Bars
Salty Cocoa Nut Bars.description: Salty cocoa nut bars are a type of snack bar that typically consists of a mixture of nuts, seeds, and dried fruits that are bound together with a sweet and salty mixture of cocoa, honey or maple syrup, and a pinch of salt. These may not have much appeal to younger folk, but after a long day at work and heading towards the inn, a commoner might choose to have a couple of these as a replacement meal.

Samarskite.name: Samarskite
Samarskite.description: Samarskite, a scarce semi-precious gemstone, is sought after despite its lower price. It is rarely worn and traditionally reserved for ceremonies honoring the loss of a loved one.

Samite.name: Samite
Samite.description: One of the most luxurious and heavy silks throughout the realms, mainly used in ecclesiastical robes, vestments, ornamental fabrics, and interior decoration. For those of royal blood it is assumed that a combination of cloth made out of gold and samite is used for their clothing.

Samson Fish.name: Samson Fish
Samson Fish.description: Samson Fish, rarely referred to as the Kingfish due to its large size, is not considered ideal for cooking as it often contains various parasites. Instead, it is primarily sought after as a trophy catch in many sports fishing competitions rather than for consumption.

Sandalwood Log.name: Sandalwood Log
Sandalwood Log.description: Sandalwood is primarily harvested for its oil. The Sandalwood forests are considered one of the most expensive woods within the realms. From the oil, a lot can be crafted such as perfumes, soaps, candles, and incense, as well as, if turned into a fine powder, for medicine, religious or cultural purposes, also, as a flavor for foods and beverages.

Sandalwood Lumber.name: Sandalwood Lumber
Sandalwood Lumber.description: Sandalwood is extremely rare and precious, it is used for intricate carvings, to make sturdy furniture, medicines, cosmetics, and religious rites. The heartwood of the tree is treasured for its aroma and is one of the finest natural materials for making beautifully carved furniture and tools.

Sandalwood Oil.name: Sandalwood Oil
Sandalwood Oil.description: Harvested from the Sandalwood tree it is mainly used by herbalists to create poultices, mainly for skin irritation and diseases, however, the oil can be also used in cooking to add a mild sandalwood flavor to most recipes.

Sandwich.name: Sandwich
Sandwich.description:
"Rumor has it that the knowledge of making sandwiches has disappeared over the years. Recently, a traveler named Peach mentioned that my compendium lacked any sandwich recipes, and I felt a bit bad for this oversight, particularly since sandwiches are so well-known. Nevertheless, I believe I possess notes from an old weary traveler on how to prepare one."

A sandwich is a food item made of two pieces of bread with a filling in between, usually consumed as a light meal. The filling can be anything the creator chooses, ranging from eggs and bacon to jams and cooked beans.

Sanguine Cocktail.name: Sanguine Cocktail
Sanguine Cocktail.description: I first saw this in The Gilded Sea Horse, a tavern tucked away in a hidden back alley close to the docks, where everything smells of rot and old salt. Matel, the tavern owner, pushed the glass across the counter with the largest smirk her face could muster. In the guttering light it looks like fresh blood, a deep, viscous red that clings to the glass and runs slow enough to make you anxious. My heart skipped, then my tongue said other things. It’s sweet at first, like honeyed brambles warmed in your palm, then a pinch of lemon snaps through so you wake up. Underneath it all you get the clean bite of a highland gin distilled up in the cold hills behind Iteshti.

Sanidine.name: Sanidine
Sanidine.description: Sanidine is a gemstone commonly found on mountaintops and sporadically in desert areas. Nomadic tribes of the desert believe that placing it in water assists in purification, although definitive evidence is absent without arcane assistance.

Sardonyx.name: Sardonyx
Sardonyx.description: A form of agate, higher in price, usually only in a combination of two colors with black bands across. Wearing this specific gemstone as an adornment is assumed to ward off a spell, however, the details of it were lost to time.

Satin Spar.name: Satin Spar
Satin Spar.description: Satin Spar, a fibrous variety of gypsum, is distinguished by its pearly luster, sparkling sheen, and silky texture. Warriors heading into battle frequently wear these stones, believing their luster can blind far-away archers and shield them from projectiles.

Sausages.name: Sausages
Sausages.description: Created from a variety of meats, vegetables, and spices such as beef, pork, or lamb, with ingredients like peppercorns, mustard seed, coriander, paprika, chili powder, bay leaves, and more. Sausages can also be dried or smoked for a longer shelf life and a wide range of varieties of flavors.

Scallions.name: Scallions
Scallions.description: Scallions, also known as green onions in some regions, are prized for their mild flavor, which distinguishes them from other types of onions. They are prevalent in salads and various culinary dishes.

Scallop.name: Scallop
Scallop.description: Scallops are primarily found in shallow waters among seagrasses on sandy or muddy seabeds, often near deep estuaries, tidal rivers, and harbors, making them an excellent target for novice fishermen. They are primarily harvested for food and are often breaded, deep-fried, and served with coleslaw, potato fries, or mashed potatoes.

Scarecrow.name: Scarecrow
Scarecrow.description: The scarecrow, rooted in popular tradition, is a mannequin typically stuffed with straw. Its primary purpose is to deter birds or other animals from consuming seeds, crops, and fruit.

Scarlet.name: Scarlet
Scarlet.description: The most expensive woolen cloth material, often dyed with kermes dye, created from rare insects, which provides a bright red color to the fabric making it one the most expensive dyes in use. This type of material is only used by the finest seamstresses or dressmakers.

Scheelite.name: Scheelite
Scheelite.description: Scheelite gemstones are found in shades ranging from pale yellow to orange and are suitable for faceting, slicing, and polishing, making them ideal for inlay work. Larger, irregular specimens are commonly mounted in silver as pendants or used for furniture ornamentation.

Schematics.name: Schematics
Schematics.description: The schematics appear to be old, though most of the details remain, albeit faded. First, a historian is needed to date the pages, approximate what materials were used, and assess their origin. To fully restore the missing information, a master of their craft is required, as only they would possess the expertise necessary for a complete restoration.

Scorpion.name: Scorpion
Scorpion.description: Scorpions are nocturnal hunters that can be found mainly in dry regions, hiding under rocks and within burrows during the day. Their iconic tail carries a venomous stinger used to subdue prey and defend against threats. While their sting is painful to common folk, it is rarely fatal, and alchemists seek their venom for use in various potent medicine concoctions.

Scorpionfish.name: Scorpionfish
Scorpionfish.description: Scorpionfish have extremely potent venom in their sharp spines, making them one of the most poisonous creatures in the ocean. However, despite their toxicity, they are mostly considered a delicacy, often praised as one of the most delicious fish available. Proper preparation is crucial, as incorrectly handling the fish can lead to severe poisoning or even fatalities. Herbalists frequently place direct orders with fishermen to harvest the venom for medicinal and alchemical purposes.

Screamsickle Shake.name: Screamsickle Shake
Screamsickle Shake.description: A small superstition clings to the Screamsicle Shake, young children are told that if you spill a drop on the wooden floor, will make next year crop fail. I have a feeling this was invented by tired mothers who didn’t want sticky footprints on their clean floors. Still, I never dared spill my own cup at my mother's house, and I’m not about to test the spirits patience now.

Scythe.name: Scythe
Scythe.description: The scythe is a tool predominantly utilized by farmers for mowing grass, grain, or other crops, the scythe consists of a long, curving blade attached at an angle to an extended handle. In certain regions, it carries an association with death, a belief particularly held by the most superstitious commoners.

Sea Daric.name: Sea Daric
Sea Daric.description: A gleaming gold disc, emblazoned with a highly detailed carved skull. These coins are often crafted from pillaged gold obtained from various sources such as gold coins, jewelry, and gold bars. The weight of the coin itself is heavy, serving as a tangible reminder of the riches and dangers of the high seas. Throughout the minting process, the crafter ensures that the gold is as close to 100% pure as possible, making it one of the most valuable coins in circulation.

Sea Salt.name: Sea Salt
Sea Salt.description: Sea salt, often known as bay salt, is harvested by evaporating seawater, either through boiling or by allowing the sun to do the work in specialized coastal salt works, known as salterns. This mineral is essential in cooking, food preservation, alchemy, leather tanning, and countless other uses.

Seafinder Coin.name: Seafinder Coin
Seafinder Coin.description: A coin made for sea captains, for long trips, mainly used for superstition. Prior to setting sail on a lenghty journey, the captain will throw one of these coins into the waters to appease the gods or the sea itself depending on his beliefs. The coin is usually made out of silver with an gem that can range from Blue Topaz to the inexpensive Chrysocolla.

Seed Potato.name: Seed Potato
Seed Potato.description: Seed potatoes are potatoes that are chosen for planting in the next growing cycle. Unlike mature potatoes that have been through several harvests, seed potatoes are harvested earlier in the growing process. While they are used for planting, they are still suitable for cooking just like regular potatoes.

Seeds - Corn.name: Seeds - Corn
Seeds - Corn.description: Corn seeds are small, hard kernels that come from the corn plant. They are used to grow corn, which is a staple food in many parts of the world, as well as used to create biscuits, fillings, cookies, beer, and ales. Making it a highly demanded trade good.

Seeds - Hyacinth.name: Seeds - Hyacinth
Seeds - Hyacinth.description: The small, round bulbs of the hyacinth plant were traditionally used to treat a variety of ailments, such as skin rashes, as well as in cooking in a variety of dishes. However, they are mainly sold for indoor decoration by planting them in flowerpots.

Seeds - Pumpkin.name: Seeds - Pumpkin
Seeds - Pumpkin.description: Pumpkin seeds are small, hard seeds that come from pumpkins. They can be roasted and eaten as a snack or used to make oil and other products. Pumpkin seeds might be imbued with the power to cure illnesses, making them a valuable commodity for herbalists and those seeking to improve their health.

Seeds - Sunflower.name: Seeds - Sunflower
Seeds - Sunflower.description: Sunflower seeds are small, hard seeds that come from the sunflower plant. They are often roasted and eaten as a snack or used to produce oil and other products.

Seeds - Wheat.name: Seeds - Wheat
Seeds - Wheat.description: Wheat seeds are small, brown seeds that come from the wheat plant. They are used to grow wheat, a grain that, when ground, is used to make bread, pasta, and other baked goods. It is also one of the most traded goods, along with corn seeds.

Seleneium.name: Seleneium
Seleneium.description: Selenium is a rare and precious mineral that is highly sought after for its unique properties. It is said to have a deep, iridescent luster that shimmers with every color of the rainbow. When it is struck with a hammer or chisel, it gives off a pure, clear tone that is said to have a soothing effect on those who hear it. Despite its many wondrous properties, Selenium is also said to be incredibly difficult to obtain, and many brave and daring adventurers have set out in search of it, only to be met with failure or their demise.

Serpentine.name: Serpentine
Serpentine.description: Serpentine, sometimes referred to as "Poor man's Jade", is a relatively common gemstone. It is typically cut into round or oval shapes known as cabochons, which are then used to adorn weapons, armor, or jewelry.

Sewing Needle.name: Sewing Needle
Sewing Needle.description: A sewing needle, utilized for hand-sewing and crafted from steel or bone, is a long slender tool with a pointed tip at one end and a hole, or eye, designed to hold the sewing thread.

Sextant.name: Sextant
Sextant.description: The sextant is a navigation instrument designed to measure the angular distance between two visible objects. Primarily, it is used to measure the angle between an astronomical body, such as a star or a moon, and the horizon, which is crucial for nautical navigation.

Shallot.name: Shallot
Shallot.description: Shallots are widely used in cooking and can be pickled as well. Thinly sliced and deep-fried shallots are commonly used as a condiment in cuisine, especially with porridge. They offer a flavor akin to onions but with a milder profile. Like onions, cutting raw shallots releases compounds that irritate the eyes and cause tears. Some herbalists collect shallots for making poultices, harnessing the shallots and their tear-inducing qualities.

Shapeshifter.name: Shapeshifter
Shapeshifter.description: Traders like me see jars of apple jam moving by the crate in early autumn, traded from orchard stewards to dairy farms and back again, all so this one concoction can be made for a handful of nights. It doesn’t hold very well, by following morning it clots and sours, which is why no one ships it far, one of it's reasons that it got its weird name, but kids love it.

Shark Teeth.name: Shark Teeth
Shark Teeth.description: Shark teeth are very popular to trade, collect, and sell, making them a very valuable commodity. Depending on the region the shark's teeth are used as weapons or spearheads. They are also used as tools that help to cut food, carve wood, or dig with. They are also used to make jewelry, mainly necklaces and bracelets.

Ship Log.name: Ship Log
Ship Log.description: A detailed log written by the captain of a vessel that contains information categorized by date. It includes the captain's thoughts at the time, as well as the locations traveled, ship status and repairs, star charts, onboard incidents, rations remaining, direction headed, and cargo. Most captains primarily use it as a journal for their current voyage.

Shorthorn Beef.name: Shorthorn Beef
Shorthorn Beef.description: This particular beef slice is known by many names, and those with a refined taste often delve into tracing the meat's location and the bovine's genealogical tree to sell it at a premium.

Shovel.name: Shovel
Shovel.description: The Shovel is a tool used to dig as well as to move loose dirt, gravel, grain, or snow, from one spot to another. It can also be used for making trenches and uprooting deep-rooted weeds and plants.

Shrimp.name: Shrimp
Shrimp.description: Shrimp are usually captured through trawling, a fishing method in which one or more ships drag a large net behind them, sweeping up any sea creatures in its path. Because the Shrimp is not the sole target of this fishing method, their availability can be quite inconsistent, leading to high prices in town markets.

Sickle.name: Sickle
Sickle.description: The sickle being one of the most common hand tools, finds extensive use in harvesting crops, cutting grass, and assisting in the gathering of vegetables from fields. The versatility of its blade extends to having a major role as a weapon in certain regions.

Siglos.name: Siglos
Siglos.description: These coins are crafted exclusively by monasteries for their parishioners who are merchants. They are typically made from stone and decorated with religious symbols and colors. The coins are distributed to merchants who travel to wealthier regions so that they can access services without having to pay extra. These services may include lodging, education, or meetings with the local high priests.

Silk.name: Silk
Silk.description: It is one of the rarest materials to find. It is mainly produced by either fantastical beasts or insects of different sizes. It is speculated that only the most trained gatherers can create something called "Pure Silk", however, some of them end up losing their lives sometimes, getting more than they bargained for from some eight-legged monsters.

Silphium.name: Silphium
Silphium.description: Silphium, also known as laserwort, is a rare and exotic plant utilized by expert alchemists and herbalists for various purposes. Its uses include functioning as a spice, a component in perfumes, an aphrodisiac, and a medicinal remedy. It treats ailments such as coughs, sore throats, fevers, indigestion, general pain, and warts, and it also acts as a contraceptive.

Siltstone.name: Siltstone
Siltstone.description: Siltstone, a type of mudrock, is made of compressed clay and silt. It absorbs water well, making it useful for aquifers and water storage but unsuitable for most construction due to its porous nature, and when it is, it is primarily used in areas where no other type of rock material is available.

Siltstone Slabs.name: Siltstone Slabs
Siltstone Slabs.description: Siltstone blocks are primarily used as dimension stones, where they can be cut into blocks or slabs for architectural purposes or for polishing certain metals, such as steel. In high-density areas, they are commonly used for indoor flooring, landscape decoration, and garden walls.

Silver Blue Spinel Ring.name: Silver Blue Spinel Ring
Silver Blue Spinel Ring.description: Dark blue spinel, a beautiful gem, is cut by skilled gemcutters and embedded into a silver or iron ring. Even though it is set in more affordable metals, the spinel itself elevates the ring's value to a level comparable with those made of more precious materials. Its rich hue of the gem, makes the ring highly desirable by nobility.

Silver Earings.name: Silver Earings
Silver Earings.description: To avoid the high prices of gem-inlaid implements, earrings made solely from silver are also crafted. Aside from being a precious metal, silver offers the added benefit of being easier to mold, allowing artisans to create intricate patterns and detailed designs, while keeping the cost accessible to the average commoner.

Silver Goblet.name: Silver Goblet
Silver Goblet.description: Silver goblets, along with other pieces such as plates, platters, cutlery, and eating utensils, are ever-present in a noble household. These items are often commissioned in bulk, typically from a dedicated smithy or the local blacksmith. In most cases, the noble provides the silver ingots required for the commission, having full control over the final product.

Silver Ingot.name: Silver Ingot
Silver Ingot.description:
Silver Ingots, once produced, have a multitude of uses and are sought after by craftsmen of all trades. They can be fashioned into boxes that preserve wine and food, cutlery, fine art, gemmed jewelry, and even masterfully crafted armor and weaponry. Depending on the region, silver can sometimes surpass even the most brilliant-cut diamonds in its price.

Silver Ore.name: Silver Ore
Silver Ore.description:
Silver Ore is one of the most sought-after ores, valued for its use in metallurgy and coinage. It is commonly made as an alloy with other metals and is the primary material for minting the most circulated type of coin. Unlike gold, which is often hoarded by the elite, silver circulates widely, fueling trade across vast empires. It can also be ground into fine dust for use in the making of mirrors and weaponry, as it is known to hunt down creatures of the night.
